oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Holy Sanctuary Church tour, 2000 June 4
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording opening on the parking lot outside of the church. Professor Ralph W. Hood stands next to the church’s sign before walking into the massive building. The recording shows the interior of the church with its high vaulted ceilings and many rows of pews. The camera moves forward to the altar and reveals the sound system and piano before continuing to pan around the altar area. Hood speaks with a man as the camera continues to take in the building. A central feature of which is a bath. A man tells the crew that almost the whole church was built by the congregation.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Appalachian Region, Southern -- Religious life and customs; Snake cults (Holiness churches) -- Appalachian Region, Southern
Hood, Ralph W.
Holy Sanctuary Church (Berea, Ky.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson field recordings, interviews, and photographs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson Holiness Churches of Appalachia recordings and interviews
